chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) [Modifiers: Repeater] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Repeater]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) [Modifiers: Repeater] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Repeater] was dismissed by the court.

  • Glenn P. Benz was found guilty of OWI (6th) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with B. or S. Decker as named in the complaint of 15CM319.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 15CF172, 15CM319, & 15TR3002 cases called at 10:56 pm. Defendant Glenn P. Benz in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by DA Blader-resolution reached. Amended Criminal complaint addressed on 15CF172. Attorney Szilagyi confirms receipt, waives formal reading. Preliminary hearing waived. Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Szilagyi confirms receipt, waives formal reading.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Guilty to Count 1.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Count 2 and dismisses and reads-in Counts 3 & 4, 15CM319 & 15TR3002. Statement by DA Blader. Statement by Attorney Szilagyi. Statement by Defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 48 months Wisconsin State Prison to be served as: 18 months Initial Confinement and 30 months Extended Supervision. 57 days of credit for time served. CONDTIONS of ES: $3000.00 fine inclusive of costs, 36 mo DL Revocation, 36 mo IID-effective today, AODA and follow through, Maintain Absolute Sobriety, Defendant is not to be on the premises of any bars, defendant is not to possess/ingest any impairing substance unless prescribed by a treating physician. Terms of Agent. No Contact with B. & S. Decker as named in the complaint of 15CM319. Court finds the defendant not eligible for CIP but finds eligible for SAP. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-13-2016 10:30 am

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  P/S requested and scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 10:30 am.
